content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

It looks like Thunderbird ignores the username field when creating an account manually.

content:
Hi David.

I am surprised that you used to use these addresses in separate accounts. I believe that they are not separate accounts at Proton, but aliases for one account. Do you have three separate accounts in webmail at proton.com or just one? Does mail sent to any of these addresses go to the one, same account at proton.com or different accounts there?

I believe that you have set up the same account three times in Thunderbird.

You might find benefits in using one account in Thunderbird, identities, and a message filter to file incoming mail by alias into separate sub-folders of your inbox.

You could check my understanding by looking at help information on proton.com.

content: Sorry, that's how IMAP works. Are you sure the new email address can't be set for POP? Anyway, with IMAP, I suggest you each set up filters to COPY desired messages to a separate folder. You would each have to folders other than the inbox, HIS and HERS. The filter could COPY those that are typically to you ( such as those from your personal or business contacts) her filter could the same. Then, browse through other mail in the inbox and copy those to the HIS folder. You would each be able to 'see' the others folder, but you're in a trusting relationship so that wouldn't be an issue. A BENEFIT of an IMAP account is that you could then read messages on your phone.
creator: davidsk

content: TIP: Gmail does allow POP. There is a setting in the online account to allow POP.

content:
Thanks David. I had a default account defined. I have four different accounts all had the same issue. The problem was solved with the following:

Thunderbird not opening compose windows (new message, reply, forward) This issue, where clicking on "New Message", "Reply", or "Forward" in Thunderbird doesn't open the compose window, is a common problem with several potential causes. Here's a breakdown of troubleshooting steps to get you back to sending emails:

1. Restart Thunderbird in Troubleshoot Mode If Thunderbird is running, click ≡ > Help > Troubleshoot Mode... and choose Restart. If Thunderbird is closed, hold down the Shift key while starting Thunderbird. In the Thunderbird Troubleshoot Mode dialog box, click Continue in Troubleshoot Mode. If the compose window opens now, it suggests an Add-on or Theme might be interfering. You will need to re-enable add-ons one at a time until you locate the offender.

content:
Visually it looks like a good profile. in thunderbird, try this: - tools>import>import from a thunderbird installation - then select 'choose a profile folder' and select your unzipped folder - if it works, you're done. free beer for everyone - if you get an error message, please share it.

- if not, the goodies are still there. - click tools>import a file, then click to import addressbook, then click the sqlite option and select the abook.sqlite file in your folder - repeat that for the history.sqlite file and you will now have your full addressbook. - if you had a POP account, exit thunderbird and look in the Mail\<POPaccount> folder and copy the inbox and sent files to the Mail\Local Folders folder in the new profile - If there are files in the Mail\Local Folders folder, copy directly to the Mail\Local Folders folder in new profile - now restart thunderbird and confirm that the copies worked.
creator: davidsk

content: sometimes thunderbird doesn't like a profile for whatever reason, or doesn't like the accounts there. to see what profile is the default, try this: - help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles' - is yours listed? If so, can you click the 'launch' button? Or is it already the default? PLEASE let me know. - if it's your profile, see if the addressbook is yours ( press Alt key to show menu bar, then click tools>addressbook let me know - your response will help us salvage the profile content. we'll get there. :) I'm glad to assist. content: I'm encouraged about addressbook. That is not account-specific, so it should be the entire addressbook. Let's take a different approach. - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles' - click the 'create profile' button - click next - enter a short name such as MYPROFILE - note the name of the profile that is going to be created. remember it - press finish - now exit thunderbird - now, in windows file explorer, select everything in your exported profile folder and paste it into that profile you just created. you may be prompted for an overwrite. do it. - you now have everything in a profile that thunderbird recognizes - restart thunderbird, reclick the steps to help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll to 'profiles', click 'about: profiles' - now, click the launch button on your profile - let me know how it goes
creator: davidsk

content:
Since your profile is the default and you had pasted your content in it, let's go with that. start thunderbird and skip the page to create an account once on the regular screen, see if your Local Folders are there and if any POP folders there. see if addressbook is there also.

at this point, we're in salvage mode. for whatever is missing, I would do this:

  1. install the importexporttools NG addon
  2. highlight Local Folders and rightclick
  3. select the importexport option to import mbox
  4. select one of the folders in the exported zip profile's Mail\Local Folders folder and import (all msf entries can be ignored)
  5. repeat this for all such folders
  6. now, do this for the inbox and sent folders in the Mail\<POPaccount> folders

The above steps capture all available messages. Now, create the accounts you had before the crash. If the addressbook is missing or incomplete, do this

  1. exit thunderbird
  2. copy the abook.sqlite and the history.sqlite files from your exported profile to the root folder of the profile. there will already be files of same name so paste and authorize the overwriting.

Let me know how it goes.

creator: malcolmemery12345

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next
